articles.title: DiZoglio files emergency motion after AG Campbell moves to strike down audit lawsuit
articles.description:
State Auditor Diana DiZoglio sued legislative leaders recently in an attempt to force their compliance with an audit.

The post DiZoglio files emergency motion after AG Campbell moves to strike down audit lawsuit appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio filed an emergency motion regarding her audit lawsuit against legislative leaders.
Attorney General Andrea Campbell seeks to dismiss DiZoglio's lawsuit, impacting state audit processes.
Boston residents may face delays in transparency and accountability in state financial matters.

articles.title: This speech-language therapist is running Boston to fund autism support services
articles.description:
"Autism can be so misunderstood, and I appreciate this chance to spread understanding, acceptance, and opportunity."

The post This speech-language therapist is running Boston to fund autism support services appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Speech-language therapist Carrie Kerstein is running the Boston Marathon to raise funds for autism services.
Kerstein aims to promote understanding and acceptance of autism through her fundraising efforts.
Funds raised will directly support local autism programs in the Boston area.

articles.title: The City of Boston handed residents $2.2M to decide funding. Here’s what they picked.
articles.description:
The winning ideas include funding for immigrants’ legal defense, programs to expand access to healthy food, and initiatives supporting housing stability, workforce training, and youth financial literacy.

The post The City of Boston handed residents $2.2M to decide funding. Here’s what they picked. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Boston residents chose to allocate $2.2M for community funding initiatives.
Funding includes legal defense for immigrants and programs for healthy food access.
Initiatives also support housing stability, workforce training, and youth financial literacy.

articles.title: Someone allegedly struck her ex’s new girlfriend with a car in Newton. Now both women are facing charges.
articles.description:
Rosa Sanchez is accused of trying to kill her ex-boyfriend’s new girlfriend, Esneiry Pimentel-Lugo, minutes after Valentine’s Day ended.

The post Someone allegedly struck her ex’s new girlfriend with a car in Newton. Now both women are facing charges. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Rosa Sanchez allegedly struck Esneiry Pimentel-Lugo with a car in Newton after Valentine's Day.
The incident occurred just minutes after midnight on February 15, 2026.
Both women now face charges, raising concerns about safety in the community.

articles.title: Republican voter ID bill stalls in Senate despite Trump demands
articles.description:
The voting bill would require Americans to prove they are citizens when they register to vote, mostly through a valid U.S. passport or birth certificate. It would also require a valid photo identification before voters can cast ballots.

The post Republican voter ID bill stalls in Senate despite Trump demands appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Republican voter ID bill requiring citizenship proof stalled in Senate as of February 2026.
Bill mandates valid photo ID for voters, affecting registration processes in Massachusetts.
Local residents may face increased barriers to voting without proper identification.

articles.title: Two Boston startups join the race to create the next major weight-loss drug
articles.description:
Vivtex and Nimbus Therapeutics are working with big pharma to develop the next wave of oral obesity treatments.

The post Two Boston startups join the race to create the next major weight-loss drug appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Vivtex and Nimbus Therapeutics are developing new oral obesity treatments in Boston.
Both startups are collaborating with major pharmaceutical companies for drug development.
Successful weight-loss drugs could significantly benefit Boston residents struggling with obesity.

articles.title: MBTA police seek woman who allegedly assaulted man on Green Line
articles.description:
Police said she punched a 71-year-old man and sprayed him with pepper spray at Prudential station.

The post MBTA police seek woman who allegedly assaulted man on Green Line appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: MBTA police are searching for a woman who assaulted a 71-year-old man.
The incident occurred at Prudential station on February 27, 2026.
Residents are urged to report any information to enhance public safety.

articles.title: Monson couple in their 70s killed in three-alarm house fire
articles.description:
Firefighters from multiple towns battled roof collapses and limited water supply as they tried to reach the couple; the fire’s cause remains under investigation, authorities say.

The post Monson couple in their 70s killed in three-alarm house fire appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: A Monson couple in their 70s died in a three-alarm house fire.
Firefighters faced roof collapses and limited water supply during the response.
The fire's cause is under investigation, raising safety concerns for local residents.
